page.title: 20OUR RIVER - THE SWALE
page.content: The local river runs just on the outskirts of Helperby and Brafferton. It is a borderline between some farms. The wildlife of the river includes fish and ducks, but you do see mink, water rats and otters. Sheltered parts of the river are covered in ice in winter and the banks are very slippery. In summer the banks are covered in grasses and brambles. The fishermen park their cars in the Oak Tree car park,(one of the local pubs).After the match they come back and open the hatch. Following rain in the Dales the river water is dark brown and peaty. It is muddy after a storm. In winter the river sometimes floods the nearby fields. When there is a month of hot weather the river runs very clear and low and the fish are very easily seen. James Moorey.
